definition: sound of chopping wood, chess pieces hitting the board etc
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)

sentences.english: Mommy, can I go to play with Dingding?
sentences.chinese: 妈妈，我可以去找丁丁玩吗？

sentences.english: Your bracelets were jingling, and foam brimming over the jar.
sentences.chinese: 你的手镯丁丁当当，泡沫从你坛中溢出。

sentences.english: The dishes and bowls slid together with a clatter.
sentences.chinese: 碟子碗碰得丁丁当当的。

sentences.english: The soldiers plinked cans from a riverbank.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们从河旁丁丁当当地向罐子乱射。

sentences.english: He is “the clever little guy who outsmarts big bullies”.
sentences.chinese: 丁丁是“比外形高大的恶棍聪明的小人物”。

sentences.english: Why did Tintin and his buddies go on any of their adventures?
sentences.chinese: 为什么丁丁和他的伙伴要投身他们的任何一次冒险呢？

sentences.english: The trolley came by, dinging noisily.
sentences.chinese: 那辆无轨电车丁丁当当地开了过去。

sentences.english: Ding-ding is also climbing a tree.
Tintin’s slightly priggish character fitted the times.
sentences.chinese: 丁丁带些自负的性格特征和那个时代很契合。

sentences.english: The jingling of bicycle bells vibrated in his ears.
sentences.chinese: 自行车的丁丁当当的铃声在他耳中回响。

sentences.english: First, delicate tinkling as the metal tines jostled each other.
sentences.chinese: 首先，金属尖齿相互撞击发出了柔和的丁丁声。

definition: selfless model citizen, just like Lei Feng 雷鋒|雷锋[Lei2 Feng1]
he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
"Becks", nickname of British footballer David Beckham (see 貝克漢姆|贝克汉姆[Bei4 ke4 han4 mu3])
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
